review_body: Aman Tokyo did not disappoint. The propterty, guest room, gym, pool, and service were all outstanding. The signature Black Tea was enjoyable. On a clear day Mt Fuji could be seen from the pool and restaurant. Definitely recommend!

Jalan is our favorite country and hence, naturally we like to celebrate my wife's birthday in Japan. This year, we have decided to pamper ourselves by staying at Aman Tokyo, the first Aman that we've ever stay.With high anticipation, we arrived the hotel around 3pm, was shown to the 33rd floor lobby and served the welcome drink by a very polite receptionist. As am avid architecture fan, I must say this Kerry Hill's design is stunning and the epitome of understating luxury.Time passing by quickly while we were enjoying the lobby and we realised that it was almost 45 minutes already pass 3pm, and we were still didn't being checked in. It was quite an disappointing experience especially it is an Aman, during your birthday and also the first Aman stay. The staff sensed our unhappiness and about 10 minutes later, a lady staff came to us very apologically and brought us to our room at Level 35, the have upgraded our room to the palace viewing side. Upon entering our room, we were stunned by the view, the size and the detailing of the room, it was truly top norch. The lady also offered us coffee due to the delayed in checked in. Our unhappiness was all gone with the politeness and nice gesture of the lady.Against other reviews, we weren't offer a champagne, cake or greeting card eventhough it was booked under my wife's name, and it was her birthday. And the fact that they saw us bringing a cake with us. All the amenities in Aman Tokyo are top notch. The heated pool is stunning, the gym is so well equipped and the Japanese bath is very nice with a view of Tokyo Skytree. And the detailings of the design are impeccable, such as the heated floor at the Bath room.We had a truly enjoyable one night stay and it was the first time we swum in Tokyo! And looking forward to stay in other Aman's properties.

My work often puts me up at insanely nice hotels....and I can say with all honesty that the Aman Tokyo is among the 3 nicest hotels at which I've ever stayed--if not the best. The staff bends over backwards to do everything. They're incredibly friendly. I did not want to leave and cannot wait to return.

review_body: Great stay accentuated by a very friendly staff -- in particular, the Front Office staff were the team that made our stay excellent -- everyone from the bellmen/women, the concierge(s), to the front desk. Went to Tokyo for a birthday weekend escape, staying at Aman Tokyo for two of the three nights that we were in town. We communicated with the concierge team at Aman for a month prior to our arrival, and they assisted in making reservations at three restaurants, including a three-star Michelin restaurant that was rumored to be very hard to get in to. We arrived earlier than their check-in time, so after completing check-in procedures, we went out for lunch. When we came back, a staff member escorted us to the room, explaining all facilities in detail -- we were pleased to find that our suitcases had been delivered to our room already. We came back from a day walking/eating our way around the city, to find that the Front Office staff had arranged a bottle of wine, chocolates, and a birthday greeting card for me in the room -- very nice touch, especially since I had not mentioned to them that it was my birthday (they must have noticed the date on my passport when checking in). Check out was also pleasant, as we requested late check out to 3:30 and were given it with no problem. All-in-all a very memorable stay, making Aman Tokyo one of my favorite hotel destinations.

Impressive property! You really have to be there to experience Aman's first city hotel. And believe me, it won't disappoint you!! Love the room design and the 8-floor high lobby. There's nothing like this in Tokyo, really. (I've been to so many luxury hotels in Tokyo.) The welcome hand-made chocolate in room was amazing. It must have been one of the best chocolate i've ever tasted. (SOOOOO Good.) Every detail was impeccable. If you're not sure when you'll be back in Tokyo again, stay here to make it memorable!

I stayed at Aman Tokyo in November 2016, must say it is definitely the best hotel in Tokyo in its league.The hotel perfectly combines traditional Japanese beauty with modern design. The room is beautifully fitted, with advanced technology and a great view of Tokyo city. Service was unbelievably efficient! Any requests was addressed in a matter of minutes, I have not seen such efficient service anywhere else! We loved the in room dining breakfast, everything was so elegantly set up. Staff are very friendly and professional, what a plesent stay!If money is not an issue, look no further! You will not be disappointed.

We are always sad when we leave Tokyo but we were never sadder than when we had to leave the Aman last week. Room, etc. was amazing but what really stood out was the service. The front desk staff were always there with a warm smile. Kumiko, Aimi, the wonderful gentleman who helped me with an introduction in Japanese for my business workshop and rest of the concierge staff were simply the best I have ever experienced. They truly cared about us and took such good care of all our needs. Arigato gozai masu! We will be back soon.

The building's design is fabulous bolstered by the attention to quality of the materials and maintenance. It is an architectural gem but designed for indulgent use with everything and more in the ideal configuration for the most spoiling stay. This is one of the finest hotels in the world surely.

I made the mistake of waiting to book the Aman Tokyo while we were spending a week in the city, and therefore we could only get in for a short stay. That said, I would have rather experienced this short stay, than not go at all.I've stayed at many Amans and the top luxury hotels around the world, but honestly nothing in recent memory has impressed me this much. I truly felt like I was in heaven! We were upgraded to a corner suite, and from the moment we walked into the room, we didn't want to leave. That is saying a lot, since Tokyo is our favorite city, and there is so much to do and see! The decor was a modern take of traditional Japanese, with blonde wood everywhere, sliding doors, and floor to ceiling windows with views of Tokyo Tower, Mt. Fuji, and the Imperial Palace... And the bathroom - Oh my god! It had heated floors, and a large room with both a shower and soaking tub overlooking the city. We watched sunset over Mt. Fuji in our room, and it was one of the most incredible moments we've had in Tokyo to date. The pool is also magical, flanked with daybeds and the same fantastic view. The service everywhere was impeccable, but I wouldn't expect any less from an Aman. The front desk staff and General Manager were incredibly attentive, especially since we were hoping to extend our stay. While we were unlucky in that we couldn't extend, I wouldn't have changed anything about our stay. I write about food and travel, and while this was a destination on my personal bucket list, I would tell anyone thinking of staying here that it's worth completely it. I've stayed at many of the top Tokyo hotels, but this is an experience above and beyond your wildest Tokyo dreams! It is the most relaxing, beautiful retreat in the middle of a busy, bustling, and fun city. I hope to return to this Aman, and because of my wonderful stay here, I'm looking to change my Bali trip to include stays at the Amans there as well. Thank you Aman Tokyo for a stay that rivals my honeymoon!

review_body: I've stayed in a lot of amazing hotels. This has got to be my favourite. It has a real calmness to it. Really beautiful architecture. Genuinely lovely staff. Subliminal rooms. Our last night we shared the T bone steak. Best meal I've ever had. Also the Japanese breakfast is not to be missed. I will definitely be back.

Our four-night stay at Aman Tokyo was as close to perfect as you can possibly get. This was our first Aman experience and we're already officially "junkies". Everything is of course so well designed and engineered in Tokyo. The Aman takes this perfection and infuses it into every aspect of their first urban property - the spa, pool, lobby, room design, flawless service, exquisite food... I can't say enough good things. All of the spaces are ethereal. From the moment you walk into the cavernous lobby, you truly feel like you're experiencing a realm of heaven. And I've never experienced more intention or care given to the design of a guest room. We stayed in the Premier Room and enjoyed stunning views of the Tokyo skyline. Every member of the staff that we interacted with (before, during and after our stay) was so incredibly kind and helpful. Everyone genuinely wanted to see you happy and was interested in you. As if they saw your request or question, not as a task, but as a chance to learn from a friend or engage on a human level. As mentioned, the food was absolutely delicious. In a city like Tokyo with more michelin starred options than nearly anywhere else, choosing where to eat can be tricky. Every meal we had in Tokyo was sublime, and that includes the two meals (one breakfast in the restuarant and one room-service dinner) that we had at the Aman. If you're not won over by the Aman Tokyo website, I don't know what else could convince you. Almost once a month my partner or I will stop what we're doing and just say, "I wish we were back at the Aman Tokyo." That is usually followed by 10-15 minutes of reliving every beautiful detail that we can remember. Until next time, we have the exquisite memories to hold us over.

It was a very beautiful hotel but I didn't understand why it's so expensive.I have stayed at Conrad, Park Hyatt, Peninsula, Andaz etc... I didn't fully get why this was more expensive than those hotels except for newness.The gym was nice and open for 24 hours was a traveler friendly, which most of hotels in Tokyo won't offer this kind of service. Bath at the fitness center was outstanding to see the skyline. Swimming pool was beautiful. In room, it was calm and zen mood- very quiet, which was awesome. Additionally, slippers were very comfy, but amenity was too simple. TV set was awesome to rise when needed and hide when not in use in order not to interrupt the wonderful view. The bath salt was soothing... Yet, still I don't find a significant reason of this price difference. Good service but not as thorough as some of other hotels. The worst thing was in room dining. It was horrible. My order, chicken and egg Oyako -don was easy to cook and simple soul food - delicious and soothing; this was my very first time to be served such a yucky, hard chicken in rubber like omelette on top of rice (rice was delicious). I highly recommend that the hotel manager should review what chef cooks. This thumbs down dinner didn't meet a 5 star hotel ranking or luxury hotel name. Honestly, I had never eaten such a disgusting oyako-don throughout Japan - very shocking to be served this level of food at this hotel.Aside from that, the restaurant at the lobby was decent. Service overall was adequate. To me, it was one of good hotels in Tokyo.

review_body: It is the best hotel in Tokyo, the guest room is huge,and the lobby is amazing. Every staff is kindly and efficiently but silently. They always do the best work without attracting your attention. I stayed this hotel in Jan.13, Ms.Yuko Yoshikawa serviced us, she is a kindly and beautiful front office manager,gived us many help, made our travel better.She is such a wonderful staff of a super hotel. She used to work my own city Shanghai, and I was very happy to hear this, it's a small world! By the way ,Ms. Yuri Yarita of reservation and the check-out day's ground floor manager(I can't remember his name,but I can remember he weared a panerai watch)was also helped us for this stay so much. Everyone should experience this Aman style!

Think very carefully before booking your next hotel in Tokyo. The Aman makes the Park Hyatt look dated and positively mainstream. There is something speciall about the Aman from the warm greeting at the door. The lobby it a feat of design excellence and the feeling of Japanese zen is immediate. We stayed in a suite which leaves you wanting for nothing. The pool and spa facilities are second to none and reason enough to book here next time. The restaurants and bars are fabulous with views to match. I'm trying to find something about this hotel I found sub standard but I simply can't fault it.

My husband, daughter and I stayed here and loved it. While the experience is different than other Aman experiences, it is, nonetheless, every bit as ideal. The staff, particularly the concierge, is flawless. (They delivered on EVERYTHING!!) We will never forget the kindness shown by Aman's longtime driver. We requested to be taken by the the home of our friends who used to live in Tokyo (but left immediately after the earthquake that occurred several years ago) for a quick picture. The hotel was gracious enough to accommodate our request, but, more impressive and so appreciated, was that the driver used the return trip to the hotel to give us a quick tour of some of Tokyo's highlights. My daughter and I got more out of that 30 minute unexpected tour (and had more fun and made a ton of fantastic memories...we are still dreaming of those donuts and rice crackers) than I can ever say. We even have the best pictures in front of Tomyo Tower!! We had a guide for 4 days and it was the Aman driver (and the concierge and the most friendly and gracious bellmen ANYWHERE) who really made the strongest impression on our beautiful and special time in Tokyo. We are a family of three and stayed in a suite and had another room. Obviously, the space was more than adequate. For us, we like having a table to eat breakfast, a desk to for my daughter to continue her homework or play and a living room to relax while trying to recover from that long flight. The views of the city are terrific and while I didn't love being up at the crack of dawn because of jet lag, I sure adored watching the sunrises. As usual, Aman knows how to get the rooms super dark, which is paramount to our sleeping. The rooms were also very, very quiet. We loved the location. While it is located in the financial district, we appreciated the quietness yet the very close proximity to everything. My daughter walked with me to Starbucks or shopping every day. (Although once the person in room service found out I was sneaking off to Starbucks, they made it their mission to deliver the perfect latte each morning and they certainly did!!). We also found all the restaurants we wanted to go just a short cab ride away. I would be remiss if I didn't give a shout out to the unsung, highly trained stealth Aman housekeepers who provide unparalleled service compared to any other 5 or 6 star hotels. Aman Tokyo met the already high bar.It do not recall meeting the manager during our stay, which seems common practice when staying with Aman, but the staff we did meet made us feel very welcome, were extremely helpful and made our stay flow seamlessly. That is exactly what we expect and were, thus, beyond happy at Aman Tokyo. It would be a privilege to stay again.

By far one of the best (if not THE best) hotel i have ever been to. Breathtaking views of the city, the lobby definitely has a wow factor and the staff is incredibly welcoming and helpful with anything u may need. The spa treatments were amazing and the pool is a must during your stay! I was blown away by everything in this hotel, every little detail. Of course it comes with a price and is incredibly expensive but so worth it!

Arrived just in time for peak Sakura season. Ultra modern architectural hotel. Stunning large room with exceptional views. Nice blend of traditional ryokan and modern. Not quite up to Aman service standards as Japan has a some somewhat more rule based approach to service but they are trying hard. Very expensive and somewhat average spa. Excellent restaurant

I've been going to Tokyo annually for about 25 years. Used to stay at the Seiyo, then Peninsula. After years of staying at the Peninsula, our family ventured to try the Aman. While service is generally very good in Tokyo no matter where you go, I found the Aman to be comfortable and relaxing. I stayed in a suite. I believe it was about $1,500/night, but it's well worth the money for Tokyo. The rooms are America size, and service is superb. What I've found with the Peninsula in the last couple of years is that service seem to have dropped a bit.Note: The location of the Aman is not as good as the Peninsula, but it made us venture out of our comfort zone a bit. There is a street that takes you all the way to the area around the train track near the Peninsular and it's got a ton of really quaint stores.I'd highly recommend the Aman Tokyo if you haven't stayed there before.

I have been to a number of Aman resorts in Bali and China; and would like to give the new Aman Tokyo a try because of its great interior design and concept.The great and unique feature of Aman Tokyo is it's Onsen and its heated indoor swimming pool; both with stunning view over the skyline of Tokyo and Mt Fuji. The pool is nicely heated up despite the cold and chilling winter climate outdoor. The Onsen by the swimming pool has a huge bath with equally great view. I suppose this is the luxury about Aman Tokyo; i.e. an urban resort located at 33/F of Otemachi Tower right at the heart of Tokyo business district. The hotel is connected to Exit B2 of the Otemachi subway Station; exclusive yet convenient.I booked a deluxe junior suite, which is the standard-size room, with great view over the Palace and Mt Fuji. Room is huge by Tokyo standard, even bigger than that of the Peninsular at Ginza. The bathroom is provided with heated floor, which is great for the cold winter, with a purpose-built onsen tub with equally great view. The living area is great with a huge day-bed by the window. The design of the room is sleek and very zen.Hardware is perfect; no complaints at all. The service is not up to the other Aman resorts offered in the other parts of the world. Service at the pool is great but that at the restaurant could have been improved.Breakfast selection is limited, they only offer American, continental and Japanese breakfast at Yen42,000 ++. The had dinner at the restaurant once; food quality is average but the service at the restaurant for both the breakfast and dinner could have been more attentive, bearing in mind the rate of the standard room is 3 times that of the Peninsular, i.e. almost US$1,500 per night. I would have expected more attentive services at the restaurant. The next question is: would I recommend Aman Tokyo to anyone. Yes and no. If you have time to spend enjoying a relaxing afternoon or evening at the heated pool and onsen; I would highly recommend Aman Tokyo, as there isn't any hotel in Tokyo which offers similar facilities; i.e an oasis in the heart of busy Tokyo. But if one is going to Tokyo to sight -see or shopping and doesn't have the time to relax and enjoy the facilities, the rates at US$15,000 per night is not value for the money.

From the moment we were picked up at the airport.Every thing went smoothly and with the minimum fuss.Our luggage went straight to the corner suite ,which was exactly what we had booked.Checkin was quick and easy.We were shown around the magnificent lobby on the 33rd level. The resteraunt, Bar, Librarey, Conciarge and afternoon tea areas all had a relaxing air about them. The staff were extreme helpful and efficient.Our suite was magnificent.Entrance area, To the left Kitchen ,Dining and Lounge , Office and second toilet areas.To the right an extremely spacious, bed, sitting room with dressing area . Full bath room with double basins, separate toilet, shower and deep ( and extremely comfortable), Japanese Bath.Floor to ceiling windows on two sides gave magnificent views of Tokyo both day and night. Two sets of electric controlled blinds to either cut out the heat or creat pitch black for sleeping.All the necessary amenities includingNesspresso Coffee machine.THe bed was wonderful.Breakfast was excellent with a great choice.WE ate at all 4 eating ares and the food was delicious.The staff were exemplary. THere was not a thing that was a problem or too much trouble for them.As the AMAN is directly over a major train station travel and connections to all parts of Tokyo is very easy. But taxies are also not expensive and plentiful.The AMAN were extremely helpful in organizing day trips for us and all their recommendations were spot on.We will definitely be back.

Beautiful hotel but woefully overpriced. We stayed at Ritz Carlton first, for 2 nights and it was every bit as nice , for a lot less money than the Aman.Rooms spacious at both and both staffs try hard to please.Eating breakfast and a late dessert at the Aman was also disappointing as it seems clearing dirty plates is something they have not be trained on.Extremely inferior for such a high priced hotel.Over all it is overpriced and not up to standards of other luxury hotels around the world we have stayed in.

The lobby is spectacular. the pool and gym even better. very nice rooms unfortunately no connecting doors.We travel 15 weeks a year and have stayed at a very large number of luxury hotels around the world.

review_body: Love the details and artwork at this hotel. The zen feel when you enter the hotel lobby at the top floor. It's the first city Aman we've ever visited and it's a different feel then what we're used to. The GM never came to greet us personally like in other Aman's but all the staff was attentive and they remember you so I guess that makes up for it. The concierge was very helpful but they don't necessary suggest good things (they just google which you can basically do yourself). If you want good concierge then I suggest The Peninsula or The Four Seasons Hotel. However if you know already where you want to go，they will help you make the reservations and point you where to go. Rooms are large for Tokyo hotels and view is very nice!!

I have visited around 20 Aman properties worldwide - Aman Tokyo does not follow the same ethos as the other 19.The design and 'wow' statement is definitely there and the atrium is magnificent , but :1) the Aman welcome is definitely missing2) the hotel is more of a destination venue, encouraging casual visitors to the bar and restaurant - constant loud music in the atrium, particularly at night , is irritating and unnecessary - it is not Japanese or calming but almost disco music 3) the restaurant is Italian - fine for the locals , but not not have a premier Japanese restaurant in such a setting is surprising4) there appears to be no visible management - no hosting as such - the staff are friendly but distant and their interaction is limited to constant hello and goodbye as you come and go5) the room we had 'palace view' was good but not exceptional - small bathroom , limited seating . The design was interesting and the views, including Mt.Fuji were superb6) the spa is good but again not outstanding , the library , which is usually a place of reflection at Aman properties , is next to the lobby with the disco music7) as a business hotel ( which seemed to be the case for many) it is too expensive , as a destination hotel - perhaps a unique visit for the local clientele , but as an Aman ( the word means peaceful) it misses the mark.I conclude that Aman Tokyo is trying to be all things to all people and not completely satisfying any of them. I left a bit disappointed .

The most beautiful hotel in Tokyo, another Kerry Hill masterpiece. The rooms and corridors are very Aman in feel, large simple quietly luxurious. Wonderful views of the palace grounds, the city behind it and most days Mt Fuji. Well equipped gym, pool, Japanese bath ( separate for men and women) and 2 large steam rooms. I found the bath not hot enough compared to other onsen and hence didn't return. Housekeeping very responsive as well as room service. However do not expect the same welcome and recognition that is present in all the other Amanresorts we have stayed in. You are not personally greeted by the resident manager or GM but do receive the usual greeting drink. No one remembers your name, other then one door man. Apart from the library which is limited for guest use, the public areas are crowded with non resident visitors. The ambience is more like the public areas at the Oriental in Bangkok or MO in Tokyo. There is no complimentary afternoon tea or drinks with a cultural performance. Concierge is not as savvy as say at MO, Capital Hotel Tokyu or FS. All the staff we came across were courteous and polite.If you stay not expecting an Aman experience but a well run busy beautiful city hotel in a great spot try it. It is very expensive even for Tokyo.

Aman Tokyo is a curious 'variation' of the Aman experience. It is located in a block in a rather exclusive area of Tokyo and it occupies only the top 2 or 3 floors. The ground level though is efficiently manned by the Aman staff which means checking in is no problem. Unlike most of the other Aman's world wide, this is one Aman that lacks the gorgeous or interesting surroundings that usually signify the Aman identity. BUT all is not lost. In the main area of the building Aman has this magnificent view of Tokyo - a wonderful panorama of Tokyo covering a wide area from the Tokyo tower to the gardens of the Palace. As can be expected, this is a popular area and we suspect that non-hotel guests were amongst those who sat there for many hours day and night to enjoy the view. The Aman serves a high tea (Japanese style - which is less 'rich' than regular high tea's anywhere else) for guests which means there is a good reason to be there.We arrived rather early but to our delight, we were given our room immediately - because it was available! none of that pretending most hotels do to discourage early check-ins. And the room was a delight - frankly - so clean and so 'big' unlike most Japanese hotels. Cleaning services were excellent - efficient and 'quiet'. And our room had this magnificent view of Tokyo as well.My only complaint was the mattress. Strangely, i found it very lumpy. In the centre it was so soft and uneven i had trouble sleeping well. But because i loved the place so much i only commented on it when we left. I think i did that because knowing the reactions of the Japanese, they would be distraught that i had a problem and would have fussed over it. My fault!! Just a comment over the swimming pool- lovely long pool but because of the sombre grey tones in the tiles etc, it was not very inviting. It would be good though for serious swimmers doing laps. I cannot imagine though families with children using the pool.

As an avid Amanjunkie I was very much looking forward to experiencing The Aman Tokyo.My expectations were definitely surpassed from the moment I arrived into the awe-inspiring Atrium Lobby! I had seen it in pictures but being in that space "live" took my breath away.My stay continued with the discreet and gracious service Aman is so well known for. Attention to detail seems to be every staff member's priority.I loved The Lounge in the Lobby both for drinks and a delectable Afternoon Tea! Once again this space is unique in the world!The Spa was another experience that soared beyond my expectations. The pool and wet areas were a perfect mix of traditional Japanese bathhouse and world-class urban spa. Thanks to my Therapist Mizue Tabogami, I experienced the absolute best Shiatsu Journey of my entire life! The spa team were very flexible in my request to customize my spa journey which was 3 hours long. I was not planning on returning to the spa the next day but immediately booked another Shiatsu treatment for the next day. It's not everyday that you are given the opportunity to receive such high-level therapeutic body work!Unfortunately on the last night of my stay I had a very negative and so "un-Aman" experience in The Restaurant by Aman where I had dinner. The service and the food was not up to the Aman Standards I am accustomed to. When I tried to find solutions to the issues with the Restaurant Manager, it just made things worse. She expressed clear irritation in having to deal with me and I felt totally under-valued as a Guest. The energy was so tense that I decided to leave and order from in-room dining in my room. A very sad end to an unforgettable stay.The next day I addressed a long letter to the F & B Manager expressing my disappointment and regrets from my experience the night before. It has now been over 6 weeks and I have not received a response even though the Front Office staff confirmed that it was received and that my letter was being examined by top management in the hotel. Once again, this was a first for me as an "Amanjunkie" having visited dozens of Aman properties around the worldAll in all I highly recommend The Aman Tokyo and I will return. I will, however, NOTdine at The Restaurant by Aman.

My wife and I are avid business and leisure travelers throughout the world. The Aman Tokyo is probably the most magnificent non-resort "city" hotel that we have ever stayed in. It takes your breathe away. The rooms are supersized luxury with no detail left overlooked. Soaring high above the city in the Otemachi Tower, guests are literally transported to King of the World status. The service staff and management is incredibly well trained and attends (even anticipates) your every need. I was literally blown away by this hotel experience from the architecture, rooms, dining options, quality, cleanliness, attentiveness and overall "zen." This is by far and away the nicest hotel in all of Tokyo (and beyond) and is a DO NOT MISS experience of a lifetime. Arigatou gozaimasta. Brad Rose

review_body: We traveled to Japan to see the sakura. We booked Aman Tokyo. It was a dream stay. High above Tokyo the views are breath-taking. The facility is world class. The service exceeds your wildest imagination and takes service to a new level. The general manager took the time to greet us as well as find the time to say thanks before we left. You have your own personal furo in the room complete with shower facilities just like an onsen. Pricey but well worth the experience and everyone makes you feel appreciated and honored.

We stayed for a night at the Aman before flying back to England. What a treat. This hotel deserves to be named as one of the best hotels in Japan. The staff could not be more helpful, friendly and welcoming. The hotel itself is only 2 years old and the rooms are modern in feel, spacious and with THE most incredible views overlooking Tokyo and Mount Fuji in the distance. My husband and I had treatments in the spa (reflexology and a facial) and we both came out saying that they had been one of the best, if not the best, spa treatments we had ever had. Yes, the Aman is expensive, but in this case, it was worth it.

Have been to many big name hotels in Tokyo such as FS, MO, RC, Andaz, PH, Aman is definitely the best. The design of the hotel is absolutely magnificent while remaining Japanese minimalist. It's extremely Kerry Hill. Rooms are spacious with the best view in Tokyo. Actually the lowest category rooms are pretty much twice the size of the rooms in other luxury hotels in Tokyo. I received an upgrade to a suite. I came to Tokyo by myself that time and it was too lavish for a solo traveler..... Although opened last year, some parts of the room is already wearing down such as the leather on the shelves.Concierge was disappointing and does need improvement. Aman is used to resorts and probably not a city hotel especially for a city like Tokyo with its own rules. I booked the hotel about a month in advance and communicated with the concierge regarding restaurant arrangements. For each email I had to wait a day to get a response.It is common knowledge that restaurant slots fill in a sec in Tokyo and I do expect faster responses. Below is the story:There was a guest stayed at Aman before and booked a restaurant via Aman. However, he didn't show up or something. Eventually Aman was held responsible for the incident and the restaurant owner/chef was punishing Aman by banning it from booking the restaurant again. It turned out that I couldn't book the restaurant and didn't give me explanation but simply"Aman Tokyo's reservation inquiry is not accepted with them" which was more than official. However, my later emails received feedback that they could book the restaurant I originally wanted, which caused a huge confusion. After I emailed them asking the the reason angrily, Aman was honest with me. I understand that Aman wanted to save its face instead of letting its customers feel it is incapable. However, confusions and conflicts come from the lack of transparency. The perfect concierge in Tokyo is definitely Ritz Carlton. When I stayed at Ritz Carlton, the concierge actually booked the restaurant before returning my email to secure the space. For every email I sent, I received a response in hours instead of days. Aman Tokyo should really work on their concierge service to satisfy global foodie amanjunkies' needs in Tokyo. Check in time is 3PM. The hotel doesn't allow early check in at all, which is not very Aman. Japanese tradition is strictly follow the rules however I do believe there are no rules for Aman? Cookies are delicious as always. Overall Aman Tokyo is definitely best of the best in Tokyo. However it is not surprisingly good as you receive good service everywhere in Tokyo. Aman has always been well above the par and I do wish it continues its tradition in Tokyo.

Knowing the AMAN brand and after looking at the website, expectations were high for our stay and we can tell that all of them were fulfilled.Of course the staff is very caring and attentive, as well as personalized, even if sometimes distant at the lounge for an afternoon drink.Rooms are huge, gorgious and absolutely perfect in details. Minimalism doesn't mean coldness or rusticity here. The layout of the room is spectacular and one of a kind. Views are incredible of course, difficult to decide which side of the building offers the best one !Japanese style breakfast is a delight and has to be tried, definitely.No word can express perfection, although it comes with a price ! But in this case, it is worth it !

In just one word, if money is no problem, do not look any further. This is the best hotel in Tokyo by far as I checked all of the luxury hotels.First of all, it is located in a very beatifull and kind of quiet neighborhood but uet you are very close to the main attractions and shopping district of Ginza. Second, you are struck by the Japanese style huge dome at the main lobby on the 32nd floor.Rooms are so great and have incredible views that you do not want to get out.And service, as expected, just impeccable.One thing that might be improved is food ordered from room service.Again, one of the best hotel experience I've ever had.

I loved the Aman hotel. The lounge area is super comfortable and welcoming, the food is brilliant. The view of Tokyo was an amazing view and the building was perfect. The rooms were brilliant with super comfy beds.Superb!

Amazing service, views, location. Super expensive but absolutely lovely. Food is either Western or Japanese and situated in a restaurant or bar with a view across Tokyo and the Imperial Park. Rooms are spacious. Lobby is amazing. Very attentive.

First and foremost the Aman Tokyo is a Fantastic hotel asset that has a great retreat feel and design but staff and management need to be on or with the offering being presented. I am not sending this review for any potential irrationality but more to help management realize more can be done to make this hotel become ranked as one of the best in the world .Part of a city hotel experience (which aman is now vying to enter into as opposed to their usual far off resort locale ) is to ensure that that management and staff need to understand the nuances of dealing with a faster pace city location and the it's customers who may have different priorities and requirements and time constraints. What is extremely important is that concierge staff should really know the ins and outs of their city ( even at different times - concierge duties end at 8pm ??) I struggled to find a venue on a few occasions and some of the venue suggested I would not really recommend - tokyo has a lot to offer and it changes . When the morning staff are there they are extremely polite and kind but you need staff with confidence and can give you direction and quick honest opinions and recommendations . furthermore if you change ( not skip) a restaurant venue you may be subject to a 100usd cancellation per person if you change or cancel which the hotel would keep ( there is always a first I guess ) the rationale and reason is things are done differently in Tokyo but at 2000 usd a night for a room you would expect staff to make a difference or be more accomadative ) . If you call the restaurant directly they would never ask you for a credit card and you can cancel in advance accordingly. The Aman concierge team need to develop much better working relationships and understanding of global traveler demands. Things do change and a hotel has to work towards working with the guest on the change (the first comment I got when I arrived jet lagged and requested to change my lunch reservation to an evening time is we may have to charge you ! - how transactional and it really took me off guardOn a very minor note , one needs to also be extremely cognizant of the service fee and taxes that aman charges above and beyond the rack rate if you book directly with them - again something I have not been really used to on my many travels and travails across the globe including other aman assets . The reference "may be subjected " means you will be 100 percent subjected , I am not one to fuss but it is close is 22 percent above and beyond the usual rack rate charges ( tax is only 8 percent) why don't you just include everything in one rate ? At least one would not really need to read the fine print ... A fantastic venue with a few changes by management , your experience may be significantly a much happier and less irritable one than mine.

The Aman is still a well-kept secret in Tokyo. We stayed for a week and frankly couldn't find a single fault. Beautiful and contemporary design, with spacious rooms, excellent views from the 33rd and higher floors, exquisite spa and discreet (yet still friendly) service. As we were warned by our travel agent, once you discover Aman properties you will never be able to stay anywhere else - alas, it's true!

While you enter the lobby, you will be amazed by the design, very high ceiling and very traditional Japanese Style. They do not have a check-in desk, but once you walk in to the lobby, you will be approached by their staff. The basic room size is huge, and the bathroom design is very special, not like other luxury hotel

The rooms in this modern, stylish and contemporary hotel are amazing. On two floors with a huge bed in the middle. A bath tub from which you can oversee Tokyo and a shower with rain shower effect. Wow, this place is amazing. The lobby, spa and pool all start on the 33rd floor and the rooms go up to floor 37.

located in the heart of Tokyo on the 33rd floor of a new tower , this amazing hotel is one of the Top 5 stars hotel I have ever seen , magnificent design with a japanease touch , really calm and quiet , Amazing view of the city and the Emperial palace, friendly and more than professional staff , you won't regret the choice.  A must try :)

Visited this place with a friend to make use of the Italian restaurant on the 33th floor. The design of the lounge and the restaurant is absolutes stunning and the few equally great. We could even see Mount Fuji. Food is really good also, quite pricy though.

Da Lat, Vietnam

review_body: This is the kind of hotel you will always remeber. Located on the top floors of recent building next to Tokyo station, this hotel has it all. Even if you have travelled the world and seen the best places you can get for money, this is perfection in architecture, service and view! The rooms are huge, which is rare in tokyo, and very nicely done in contemporary architecture. The view is amazing as the hotel is the tallest building in the area and even when you go for a swim in the amazing pool you enjoy that view. The lobby and the pool area are both done over several floors so you get the feeling of massive space, a feeling you generally don't get in japan. My personal best city hotel so far.

The best place ever to be in Tokyo, great service, beautiful Japanese style authentic suite a lot of space and wonderful view over the city, we loved it there and if u have some time make sure u visit the swimming pool as it's awesome view over the city and if u luckily on the sunset u see Mount Fuji Enjoy it

We really enjoyed our stay at the Aman Tokyo. Its expensive at almost double the price of the other premium hotels in the city - but worth it for an amazing unique Aman city experience.The Aman team were extremely friendly and helpful. They greeted us with beaming smiles every time we returned to the hotel.The interior architecture and design by Kerry Hill is their usual exceptional quality.The lobby/restaurant area is breathtaking is its minimalist design, grandeur and scale. Obviously a popular venue for the locals that packed out the space for afternoon tea each day. The corridors to the rooms are spacious and light filled.It was a treat just sitting in the pool area - even though we didn’t take a dip.The rooms are the usual Aman quality. Serene luxury, spacious, with fine detailing and an amazing outlook. The bathroom running along the side of the room was an unusual design feature, however, worked quite well. The bathroom stepped down to your private onsen and the bedroom down to the lounge area - both with amazing views of the city. The level change was great during the day, however, a little dangerous trying to get around during the night. Luckily the loo and the bed are on the top level - so you should make a mental note before you go to bed that if you get up in the middle of the night to stay high (so to speak). We find that the F&B experience at Aman often isn’t quite up to par with the likes of other luxury hotel groups such as Peninsula or Mandarin Oriental. Again we found this issue with the Aman Tokyo. The breakfast was good with an interesting a la carte selection. Dinner at “The Restaurant” was ordinary and expensive.Room for improvement:+ Improve the quality of the F & B+ Include the fruit juices as part of the complimentary bar in the room+ Provide 100% cotton robes

This was an exceptional experience from the first moment and at the moment is probably my favourite (city) hotel in the world. The onsen and pool, the cigar lounge, the breakfast, the spaciousness of the room (with its own onsen), the gym and other facilities, the fact that as I got of the taxi I was addressed by name, the (free) drop off to the station by hotel limousine - it really was fabulous.

Well I was saying Palace Tokyo is the best but after I stayed at Aman Tokyo it is also the best so I can only quote them the Co-Champion in Tokyo.Booked a room & suite and it cost me about JPY300,000 but it is worth of Oi just stay in the room like me ha ha !Swimming pool is fantastic and got us hungry.Dinner at The Restaurant is wonderful, chilled pasta with toro, cabronara, t-bone Wagyu & guinie fowl .. All so tasty !Breakfast in the room, full till can't eat lunch.

The service is above and beyond expectations. They treat you with the upmost respect and even more some. Your greeted and sent off with a bow. Japan overall has great service but Aman took it to another level. We stayed a week there with our entire family. People said it was the best and it was. One thing though it is a modern design so for elderly people just beware of steps in the room.

We are a big fan. We had to go and visit the new Aman in Tokyo. A spectacular setting. Japanese touch. Great wine cellar and exquisite tastes. Elegant atmosphere in Tokyo skyline view. Usual Aman treat. Business or celebration lunches or dinners most appropriate.

Aman properties are in a class by themselves. The Aman Tokyo is a perfect example of why. The architecture and design is minimalist yet luxurious...rooms, common space, spa, et.al. The pool is like no other; almost 100 feet long. The staff delivers impeccable service throughout. The location is convenient yet somewhat off the grid so there is a sense of privacy unusual for it's business district location. Can't imagine staying anywhere else while visiting Tokyo.

New York City, New York

review_body: So this even for the Tonytraveller this is a very expensive hotel - but it is an exceptional only once hotel. A fan (apologies Madarin) of Aman we had to visit for one night and yes it was worth it.Aman big and city is different from Aman small and personal but both are wonderful and the hotel here still has amazing staff and wonderful spaces.Breakfast while gazing at Mount Fuji and a deep bath while looking out over the night-time Tokyo skyline cannot be described. So if only for one night - do it!See my other reviews in Japan and read more at thetonytraveller.com and follow me on Twitter Tonytraveller

The overall impact when you enter the lobby of the hotel is breathtaking. It is simplistic Japanese in its finest. The architecture is overwhelming and the suites share the feeling. The staff are very thoughtful and giving. The integration of service at all levels is unprecedented--from someone to assist you in the train station to bag assistance to forward a suitcase to the Amanemu so as not to bother with it on the train.

If you have never been to a 1st class hotel in Tokyo recently, this is the best. Everything from the layout, service, employees, food, and attention to detail is magnificent. Rooms are impeccable, neat, efficient; private bath a luxury. Spa and bath excellent.Will definitely choose this again next time in Tokyo.

As a concept I was slightly sceptical about an Aman resort in a major city.However, I soon found that there's nothing quite like looking out over Tokyo from the serene calm of Aman Tokyo whether it's from the bedroom, bathroom, pool area or restaurant. You might be in a city of some 13.5 million people but it doesn't feel like there could possibly be so many people around.The rooms are simple, elegant and supremely comfortable and I really enjoyed following the bathing instructions and relaxing in the ofuro bathtub. Service and food were of the highest order. The pool was large, the gym is well equipped and the spa bathing facilities also excellent. This is another Aman resort which scores 10/10 for me. It's pricey but worth it and unique enough to justify the cost.

We have only stayed at 3 Aman hotels so far and this is the one we actually like. The other 2 Aman experiences we had were a bit underwhelming.We love the design of Aman Tokyo, which is traditional Japanese yet very chic. The lobby is stunning. We had the Premier Twin Room and the layout was like a Japanese house. There was even a genkan which is a Japanese style foyer. The bed was facing the floor to ceiling windows and the skyline of Tokyo with the view of Skytree was amazing day and night.They have excellent therapists at the Spa. We booked a second treatment right after we had our first. The pool looks very inviting but we did not have time to use. We had dinner one night at the Restaurant. Food was fusion of Japanese and Italian and everything was delicious. Service was outstanding. We tried the famous Black Afternoon Tea at the lounge. Their afternoon tea is so popular, they serve it from 11:30am to 9:30pm. However, if you are not staying at the hotel, do not expect to get a table without reservation.When we stayed at the other 2 Aman hotels, there was no need to sign for anything. At Aman Tokyo, we were asked to sign the bill at the lounge but not at the restaurant, the Spa or for the room service. We dined at the lounge twice and both times we made reservation with our room number, so they knew we were in house guests. The experience would have been more consistent if we were not asked to signed for anything at any outlet of the hotel.

The Aman smells of money! This place is so darn expensive that if you have to ask the price of anything you really shouldn't stay here... our rooms (we had two because our two teenage sons were with us) each cost about $1000 per night. It is a gorgeous hotel with perfect service and the most elegant staff I've ever seen. Breakfast is also beautiful (especially the Japanese dishes) -- we loved staying here, but I'm not sure that I would stay here again at these prices -- especially when you can stay at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel for almost half the price and that place is also gorgeous! I will add, however, that is money is not at all an issue, then there is something very private and very special about The Aman that is worth experiencing-- we were very fortunate to call it our home for 4 days.

If you could start a review by intently BOWING, it would be most appropriate. This is a wonderful hotel with a staff that is over-the-top in every way. The location is very nice, especially if you are a runner---the castle is close to the hotel location and there is a 5k running trail that surrounds it. The food is wonderful---this may sound weird, but I had the very best poached eggs in my life in the hotel restaurant---and their lattes are scrumptious also.The spa is amazing!The view is fantastic--the hotel is located from the 33rd to 38th floors, so, every room has a tremendous view!It is located right above a subway station for easy access, yet you would never know it was there....Oh, and the BMW 7-series house car is available upon request---I suggest you request well in advance.BOW.Wonderful

It is a huge cathedral hotel in Tokyo. The ceiling in the lobby, the dimensions, the colors everything is here to make it peaceful, impressive and meditative.The rooms as expected are awesomely simple and perfect. The view is just what you can expect: breath taking, and it's large, comfortable... Nothing is superfluous, but everything is there. The bathroom with the bath by the window is just whaou!Honestly I read some not so good review about the Aman Tokyo just before going but it was perfect. It may be impressively simple but that is a very peaceful and nice oversized place!!!The location in Otemachi is a walking distance from Tokyo station and shopping area of Marunouchi and Ginza, not too far away from Nihonbashi too.

I had always thought Aman+Japan was the most perfect combination possible ever and I've recently decided to give a try to ensure I was right... And YES, I was right...For their first urban property (not so first if we count the ex-Aman in New Delhi and Aman Summer Palace), Aman has opened THE hotel, every urban travelers are dreaming about. Perched at the top of the Otemachi Tower in the elegant district of Marunouchi, not far from the top end shopping area of Ginza, this is the most stunning city hotel I've seen in my entire life.Everything starts with the entrance, discreet (as always with Aman), and so beautifully designed. Staff greets you with a generous smile and this sense of service Japanese have the secret for before escorting you in what is truly the most impressive hotel lobby ever, a piece of art in itself, like a Zen garden and the soaring lobby rises 30 meters like the sky over this breathtaking architecture. Delightful traditional japanese music played by a traditionally dressed woman and straight in front of view, extensive windows overlooking the skyscrapers of Tokyo and the Fuji-san background... It is probably the most amazing view I've seen from an hotel and it gives you the feeling like floating over Tokyo.But even if this view took all your attention, you can't forget how wonderfully, the Aman japanese family welcomes you. With style, extreme kindness, unparalleled elegance, you will be escorted to your "home" because we can't talk about rooms or suites at Aman Tokyo but this kind of space where you will feel immediately at home.If possible, pick a Suite for having truly the impression to live in Tokyo. It's huge but intimate, designed in a modern Japanese style extending the comfort to the highest level you can expect. Views from Corner suites are so gorgeous and it's almost impossible to stop at looking the beauty of Tokyo. Beds are heavenly just like the bathroom looking like your own Onsen. All the materials used for the design are just exceptional (superb clear wood for the bedroom, solid black stone for the bathroom, wash paper to divide the areas...) and create a true well being sanctuary from where it will be hard to leave.But Aman has even more to offer... A fantastic spa providing probably the best treatments of Japan (at a cost for sure...); an incredible pool overlooking Tokyo simply breathtaking; lounges, library where to relax is one of these precious moments in a life; probably the most delicious afternoon tea ever with both savory and sweet delicacies so yummy and a couple of restaurants but not offering Japanese cuisine which is probably the only downside I've been able to notice. Both restaurants are beautifully designed, both with a great atmosphere but it is quite surprising there is not a place where to enjoy a traditional Kaiseki dinner because Aman tries usually to be in complete harmony with the country and not having a Japanese restaurant surprised me.However, how not to feel very special when staying at Aman Tokyo with such an interior design, with such a family looking at the smallest detail which can make happy the guests, with so many faces having a permanent smile... Don't hesitate and if you want to stay in Tokyo, choose Aman for an experience you will remember for life...

This property is unlike any other in Tokyo. The setting is magnificent, and coming off 10 days traveling through Japan, staying at onsens and inns, the Aman perfectly captured the zen mood we brought with us. The large airy lobby is quiet yet grand, with rooms off the main area for reading, concierge, and dining. In the midst of it all is a magnificent arrangement (changes - we were there in winter so it was pine branches) with a stone garden that was attended to daily). From the room's spare yet elegant decor to the fabulous tub to the daily treats from Japanese lore - every detail was spectacular. High tech in every way, yet calm and peaceful. The designers deserve accolades for finding the balance. And the staff totally 'gets it' as well. Unobtrusive yet attentive. Available when needed, invisible when not. What more could you ask for? Oh, well, a perfect location overlooking the Imperial Gardens with Mt. Fuji in the distance, easy access to subway line beneath the building, excellent restaurant and bar, walking distance to top dining and shopping. I could go on and on. Have stayed in other Tokyo properties but never again. This is all we need.

If you have ever stayed at an Aman, then this is exactly the type of service and luxury that you would expect from an Aman property. If you have never stayed at Aman, then I highly recommend that you consider this property in Tokyo. Great location and with amazing views of the Imperial palace gardens. The service is first class without being obtrusive. The mood is typical Aman - upscale, serene luxury. There is a calmness to Aman properties in which you feel like you are by yourself in the midst of many other guests. The rooms was large with all the amenities that you would expect - amazing view of the Imperial Palace Gardens. There is a beautiful pool and spa. The restaurant and bar area are great! I would recommend this place to anyone - and we will definitely return. Worth the extra $$ for the this property.

It was our first trip to Japan, and I was ready to splurge to stay in the best hotel Tokyo had to offer. After exhaustive research, I decided on the Aman. It was without question the right decision. Out of curiosity I visited some of the other hotels I had considered (and in fact stayed in the Four Seasons for two nights prior to our return to the US, as I had injured my back in Osaka and cut our trip short).The staff at the Four Seasons was superlative, meeting me at the train station with a wheelchair and attending to my every need while there (train-side greeting isn't offered by the Aman, and they should).The service there was beyond wonderful, but as much as I hate to say it, as we adored the staff there, the hotel facilities are just not comparable to the Aman. In my opinion, nothing else in Tokyo compares. Superb, warm and welcoming service, breathtaking architecture and incredibly beautiful rooms. It was like being at the world's most elegant ryokan, it was a wonderful oasis to which to return at the end of a busy day in a busy city. My only disappointment was the seasonal massage that I booked, it wasn't remarkable, which it should have been for the price. But my husband absolutely loved his shiatsu. If you are trying to decide, go to the Aman. It was phenomenal, one of my top three hotels worldwide. You will love it.

Had the absolute best experience for our honeymoon. The most calming and clean hotel I've ever been to. Very personalized! Very modern and sleek design, and the perfect place to relax, Especially in the midst of such a busy city like TOKYO!! Very accommodating to our needs and room service was great.

Spectacular very large room with a view, good Italian restaurant, lives up in every way to an Aman property, good discreet service, well located near Tokyo station and the subway. Will definitely return if back in Tokyo.

One of the newest hotel in townBest of the best in terms of location, design and service. As expected, pricy and perfect. The hotel entrance is little tucked away from the main street and it creates certain exclusive feeling of the establishment.

Among the best hotel I have ever experienced. Crisp and attentive service. Fabulous attention to detail in our room. Incredible views. Excellent though pricey spa. Stunning pool and hot bath. Excellent location hard by Imperial Gardens.

review_body: great experience, lunch was a bit disappointing but overall worth a visit, amazing view in the center of tokyo over looking the royal garden (palace). if you are looking for a relaxing and private time off at a luxury hotel in a busy city, this is the place.

The view is to die for. The rooms are spectacular. You can take a shower or bath while overlooking the entire city. The views from the top six floors ( where the hotel is located) extend from the Imperial Palace in the foreground to the city and Mt. Fuji in the background. You hardly need to leave your room! The rooms are modern, impeccably neat and organized and surprisingly large. The service is top of the line and the restaurant is imaginative while catering to individual requests. I would return again and again and again..........

Excellent. Feel out of the world from the time you arrive til you depart, every touch point with the guest is highly personalised. Tsukiji Market and Oba-San sushi dinner are experience of a lifetime. If you are allergic to being spoilt this experience is not recommended!
